context: 29 High neopterin levels have also been correlated with morphologically complex coronary lesions 43 even after adjusting for CRP levels, 27 and thus have been used as a marker for risk stratifying patients with acute coronary syndromes. 44 Finally, elevation in serum neopterin and CRP levels is better in predicting major cardiovascular end points than elevation in either marker alone. 25 The prognostic value of neopterin in cardiovascular disease is related to the fact that plaque disruption and thrombogenicity are in part determined by the number of activated T-cells and macrophages contained within atherosclerotic lesions. 45 46 Activated T-cells in vascular plaques release interferon-γ, which in turn stimulates the production and release of neopterin from macrophages. 16 The biological effects of neopterin include activation of both constitutive and inducible nitric oxide synthase with ensuing alterations in the intracellular redox state. 47 48 As a result, neopterin facilitates the translocation of nuclear factor-κB, 49 50 which then promotes the expression of adhesion molecules, tissue factor, 51 and a number of proinflammatory factors including interleukin-6 and tumor necrosis factor-α. 52 Thus, neopterin not only carries prognostic value, it may also directly contribute to the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis by augmenting the inflammatory response.
